snippet: The interim government lifts a state of emergency and a nighttime curfew after three months — an indication of its confidence in its control of the country.
abstract: Egypt's interim government lifts state of emergency and nighttime curfew, signaling its growing confidence in its ability to impose security after the unrest that followed the military ouster of Pres Mohamed Morsi.
lead_paragraph: The interim government lifts a state of emergency and a nighttime curfew after three months — an indication of its confidence in its control of the country.

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
